cell2d

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • cell2d.Animation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Animatable

    public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Animatable

    An Animation is a sequence of one or more Animatable frames that may be instantiated in an AnimationInstance in order to be displayed one after another and/or smoothly transitioned between. The frames are indexed by the integers from 0 to getNumFrames() - 1 inclusive, and each has its own duration in fracunits. Durations of 0 or less are interpreted as infinite.

    The frames of Animations may be other Animations in addition to single Sprites, which allows for the creation of multi-dimensional Animations in a similar manner to multi-dimensional arrays.

    In order to be of use, Animations need not represent linear progressions of frames; they may also be collections of counterpart Animations that need to be switched between without an AnimationInstance losing its place in them.

    Once created, Animations are static and immutable, with all movement through time happening in AnimationInstances.

    All of Animation's constructors treat a null Animatable as equivalent to Sprite.BLANK, and thus no frame of an Animation may be null.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Animation BLANK
      A blank Animation with Sprite.BLANK, duration 0, as its only frame.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animation(Animatable frame)
      Creates a new Animation with the specified Animatable object, duration 0, as its only frame.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(Animatable frame)
        Creates a new Animation with the specified Animatable object, duration 0, as its only frame.
        Parameters:
        frame - The Animatable object out of which to make the Animation

      • Animation

        public Animation(Animatable[] frames)
        Creates a new Animation with the Animatable objects in the specified array as its frames. Each frame will have a duration of one fracunit.
        Parameters:
        frames - The array of the Animation's frames

      • Animation

        public Animation(Animatable[] frames,
                 long[] frameDurations)
        Creates a new Animation out of the Animatable objects in the specified array of frames. Each frame will have a duration that is the value at its corresponding index in the array of frame durations.
        Parameters:
        frames - The array of the Animation's frames
        frameDurations - The array of the Animation's frame durations

      • Animation

        public Animation(SpriteSheet spriteSheet,
                 int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2,
                 boolean columns)
        Creates an Animation with the Sprites in a rectangular region of a SpriteSheet as its frames. Each frame will have a duration of 1.
        Parameters:
        spriteSheet - The SpriteSheet out of which to make the Animation
        x1 - The x-coordinate, in Sprites, of the region's left edge
        y1 - The y-coordinate, in Sprites, of the region's top edge
        x2 - The x-coordinate, in Sprites, of the region's right edge
        y2 - The y-coordinate, in Sprites, of the region's bottom edge
        columns - If true, the Sprites will be read from the SpriteSheet in columns from top to bottom, the columns going from left to right. Otherwise, they will be read in rows from left to right, the rows going from top to bottom. The Sprites will appear in the Animation in the order in which they are read.

      • Animation

        public Animation(SpriteSheet spriteSheet,
                 int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2,
                 boolean columns,
                 long[] frameDurations)
        Creates an Animation with the Sprites in a rectangular region of a SpriteSheet as its frames. Each frame will have a duration that is the value at its corresponding index in the array of frame durations.
        Parameters:
        spriteSheet - The SpriteSheet out of which to make the Animation
        x1 - The x-coordinate, in Sprites, of the region's left edge
        y1 - The y-coordinate, in Sprites, of the region's top edge
        x2 - The x-coordinate, in Sprites, of the region's right edge
        y2 - The y-coordinate, in Sprites, of the region's bottom edge
        columns - If true, the Sprites will be read from the SpriteSheet in columns from top to bottom, the columns going from left to right. Otherwise, they will be read in rows from left to right, the rows going from top to bottom. The Sprites will appear in the Animation in the order in which they are read.
        frameDurations - The array of the Animation's frame durations

      • getLevel

        public final int getLevel()
        Description copied from interface: Animatable
        Returns how many levels of Animations this Animatable and its frames and sub-frames comprise. For example, an Animation of Animations of Animations has a level of 3.
        Specified by:
        getLevel in interface Animatable
        Returns:

      • getFrame

        public final Animatable getFrame(int index)
        Description copied from interface: Animatable
        Returns this Animatable's frame at the specified index. If the specified index is not valid, this method will return Sprite.BLANK.
        Specified by:
        getFrame in interface Animatable
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getFrameDuration

        public final long getFrameDuration(int index)
        Description copied from interface: Animatable
        Returns the duration of the frame at the specified index. If the specified index is not valid, this method will return 0.
        Specified by:
        getFrameDuration in interface Animatable
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the frame whose duration is to be returned
        Returns:
        The duration of the frame at the specified index

      • framesAreCompatible

        public final boolean framesAreCompatible(int index1,
                                         int index2)
        Description copied from interface: Animatable
        Returns whether the two frames at the specified indices are compatible for AnimationInstances' transitioning purposes. An AnimationInstance of this Animatable, if it is an Animation, or of an Animation that incorporates this Animatable may transition between the frames at the specified indices without resetting all of its indices at its lower levels to 0 if and only if this method returns true.
        Specified by:
        framesAreCompatible in interface Animatable
        Parameters:
        index1 - The index of the first frame
        index2 - The index of the second frame
        Returns:
        Whether or not an AnimationInstance may transition between the two frames without resetting its lower indices to 0
